MM is characterized by clonal proliferation of malignant plasma cells within the bone marrow which, in most cases, leads to abnormal expansion of a monoclonal component. In several cases, MM is preceded by a monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance (MGUS) or by smoldering multiple myeloma (SMM). MGUS and SMM are asymptomatic conditions characterized by the presence of monoclonal cells.
